description.narrative: - Promote inclusion by increasing access to quality education for lower-middle income students. - Post-conflict impact. The University has a strong social mission statement and is already working in the regions with post-conflict communities. The University, as derived from the Santo Tomas de Aquino religious ethos, promotes the integral formation of the individual, with a strong academic base, complemented with compulsory social impact community work and research programs for all students, building on strong ethics. - Improve quality tertiary education in Colombia. Santo Tomas, as one of the leading universities in the country, and as the first one with multi-campus accreditation, is increasing the standards of academic offering. With this Project, the university will improve infrastructure standards in the regions, it will recognize faculty qualifications (masters and doctoral degrees), and will standardize its processes in all its campus (including open and distance learning education). - Regional productivity improvement: Santo Tomas is providing quality tertiary education in mid-sized cities like Bucaramanga, Tunja and Villavicencio with specific academic programs tailored for the regional needs. As over 50% of the universities are based in Bogota, this high-quality regional presence is critical for students to stay close to their cities of origin and reduce drop-out effects associated with moving to other cities for their studies.

mailing-address.narrative: Universidad Santo Tomas Juan Pablo Berrio Director Departamento de Planeacion y Desarrollo (57-1) 5878797, ext. 1170 juanberrio@usantotomas.edu.co Cra. 9 No. 51-11, piso 5 www.usta.edu.co
